column4: Is there a way to tell either gedit or scite that the encoding of the file I am trying to read is ISO-2022-JP?  If there is not, then is anyone familiar with a text editor other than vim or emacs that they know can support this encoding? Do I really just have to learn how to use emacs and vim? All I want to do is fill in the blanks in a template file...
I installed Ubuntu 8.10 in English, but I often work in Japanese.  Not being able to view files like this is extremely debilitating...but I'm sure there must be a way around it.
if it's raw text, you could probably open it in a browser and copy it out
if you're making a resume, you might want to try #ubuntu-jp
